intro: Tenaxia cachemyriana, commonly known as the Cachemyriana tenaxia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
